pro.ProductName: iMOT172S XM-CAN 12-48V 300 mNm Stepper motor CANopen/TMLCAN
body_html:
• « Back to Catalog

  • iMOT172S XM-CAN 12-48V 300 mNm Stepper motor CANopen/TMLCAN

  • Stepper motor with embedded drive and motion controller
    Stepper motor with an integrated freely programmable servo controller
    High dynamics and efficiency through field-oriented control (FOC)
    Operating voltage: 12 – 48 V / nominal torque: 300 mNm
    Magnetic single-turn absolute encoder with 4096 I / rev. (12 bit)
    Interface: CANopen / TMLCAN, RS232
    Connector system: Molex Micro-Fit

  • Product Details Datasheets Documentation/Software Connection Diagrams Contact Us

  • Intelligent stepper motor with embedded motion controller, position feedback, RS232 and CAN / CANopen interface. The integrated control system reduces the amount of wiring required for power supply and communication, and improves electromagnetic compatibility significantly. The intelligent motor is already optimally designed, ready for immediate operation and thus enables simple integration in small spaces.
    Electrical characteristics:
          Operating voltage: 12 - 48 VDC / nominal current: 3 A
          Nominal torque: 300 mNm @ 1200 rpm
          No load speed: 1700 rpm @ 48 VDC
    Communication:
          RS232 - up to 115 Kbit/s
          CANopen - according to CiA profiles 301, 305 and 402
          TMLCAN - Technosoft proprietary CAN protocol
    Digital and analog inputs/outputs:
          5 digital inputs: 5-24 V, NPN or PNP configurable
          2 digital outputs: 5-24 V, 0.5 A, NPN Open-Collector
          1 analog input: 12 bit, 0-5 V
    Feedback: Integrated magnetic single-turn absolute encoder with a resolution of 4096 increments per revolution (12 bit).
    Safety: Protection against over-current, over-temperature, under-voltage and over-voltage, I2t and following error.
    Integrated switch for setting the device node ID.
    Control features:
          Via fieldbus or analog / digital inputs
          Through autonomous execution of complex motion sequences directly from the non-volatile memory of the integrated controller
    Operation modes:
          Closed-loop with sinusoidal commutation and field-oriented control (FOC) when the integrated encoder is enabled
          Open loop with up to 512 microsteps per full step, step loss detection and automatic position compensation when encoder available on the load
    Operating modes:
          Position, speed and torque control
          Trajectory generator with trapezoidal and sinusoidal ramps
          Profile Position Mode, Velocity Mode, Homing Mode
          Profile Position Mode, Velocity Mode, Homing Mode
          Cyclic Synchronous Position (CSP)
          Electronic gears (EGEAR) and cams (ECAM)
          Motion contouring via position, speed, torque or voltage
          Analogue external reference, pulse and direction
    EasyMotion Studio software:
         Graphic programming interface with many wizards for simple commissioning, configuration and local programming of complex sequence programs in single-axis or multi-axis systems
          Straightforward selection of motor type, encoder interface and control structure as well as the configuration of the protections and controller parameters
          Automatic determination of the PID controller parameters (autotuning)
          Extended analysis and optimization tools integrated using the control panels, loggers and scope functionalities
    TML Library: The TML Motion Libraries can work under Windows (32-bit and 64-bit versions available), or Linux operating system and can be included in an application developed under C/C++, C#, Visual Basic, Delphi Pascal, or LabVIEW. TML_Lib is a collection of high-level functions allowing to control, from a PC, the Technosoft intelligent drives and motors. The protocol is TML and communication can take place via RS232, CAN bus, Ethernet or USB.
    Technosoft Motion Language (TML) : Using the TML language, different operating modes, movement profiles, reference runs or the control of complex sequence programs can be graphically programmed and executed autonomously. The drive controllers can process analog and digital I / O signals, perform arithmetic and logical operations, and also exchange data and commands between the axes. Single-axis and multi-axis stand-alone applications can be easily implemented with self-created sequence programs, even without the use of a complex CANopen or EtherCAT master controller.
    MotionChip ™ technology: The main core of all Technosoft servo controllers is the MotionChip ™ - an intelligent, freely programmable motion controller specially designed for complex motion control tasks. The MotionChip ™ offers the possibility to use the powerful digital signal processors (DSP) from Texas Instruments as an independent, intelligent unit. As a result, many tasks of a complex master control are solved directly by the MotionChip ™, so that the global function of a machine is relieved and the management of a master application can be optimized. All-important control functions of a controller such as a multitude of operating modes, PLC properties, protection and safety functions as well as support for the different interface and motor technologies are accommodated on the MotionChip ™, thus enabling flexible use in a wide variety of drive systems.

• « Back to Catalog

  • iPOS4850 BX-CAN 11-60V 64A 3kW CANopen/TMLCAN

  • Intelligent, compact and freely programmable motor controller
    For brushless, DC brush and step motors
    Motor supply / logic supply: 11 – 60 VDC / 9 – 36 VDC
    Output current: 64 A (45ARMS) nominal; 90 A (64ARMS) peak
    Supports various feedback options including absolute encoders
    Communication via RS232, TMLCAN and CANopen interfaces
    STO inputs with safety integrity level SIL3/Cat3/PLe
    Closed-frame design, with retractable connectors
    Size (L x W x H): 139 x 93.9 x 24.6 mm

  • Product Details Datasheets Documentation/Software Connection Diagrams Contact Us

  • The iPOS4850 BX-CAN is an intelligent high-performance drive controller with a peak power of up to 5.4 kW and a voltage input of up to 60 VDC,Making it ideal for integration into battery-powered mobile applications such as automated guided vehicles (AGVs), autonomous robots or logistics systems. The highly compact drive features the latest DSP technology with unmatched control performance, supports various types of motor and encoder technologies and is also extremely intelligent thanks to its integrated MotionChip™ controller.
    Electrical characteristics:
          Motor supply / logic supply: 11 – 60 VDC / 9 – 36 VDC
          Output current: 64 A (45ARMS)continuous; 90 A (64ARMS) peak
    Motor types:
          Brushless and servo motors (BLDC, PMSM)
          Brushed DC motors
          Direct drive Torque & Linear motors
    Feedback options:
          1st Feedback:
                Incremental encoder (ABZ)
                Digital Hall-sensors
          2nd Feedback:
                Incremental encoder
                SSI / BiSS-C
                EnDat 2.2
                Format T - Panasonic,Tamagawa (only E3xx version)
                Format A - Nikon, Sanyo Denki (only E3xx version)
    Control:
          Via CAN Bus, pulse and direction or analog/digital inputs
          Autonomous execution of complex motion sequences stored in the nonvolatile memory of the drive.
    Communication:
          RS232 - up to 115 Kbit/s
          CANopen - according to CiA profiles 301, 305 and 402
          TMLCAN - Technosoft proprietary CAN protocol
          Ethernet - optional via an additional communication module
    Supports RS232-to-CAN gateway functionality. The user can communicate via RS232 with all the drive controllers connected to the CAN bus.
    Digital and analog inputs/outputs:
          2 digital inputs: 7-36 V, PNP
          2 digital outputs: 7-36V, 0.5A NPN open-collector
          2 analog inputs: 12bits resolution, 0-5V
          Digital output for controlling an external motor/holding brake
          DIP switch for setting the unit node ID
    Safety:
          Safe Torque Off with safety integrity level SIL 3, category 3, PLe
          Extensive protection functions against overcurrent, overtemperature, undervoltage and overvoltage, short circuit, I2t, tracking error and current limitation
    Control features:
          Sinusoidal commutation with field-oriented control (FOC) via encoder, Hall sensors or sensorless.
          Outstanding resonance and vibration suppression through the flexible, simultaneous use of up to 10 BiQuad notch, low-pass, high-pass or band-pass filters.
          Gain scheduling to dynamically adjust PID controller parameters for optimal positioning performance.
          Dual-loop with simultaneous use of two different feedback sensors to compensate for gear backlash and mechanical elasticities.
          Fast and highly precise cascaded control loops with freely adjustable sampling rates and PWM switching frequency.
          Closed-loop with sinusoidal commutation and field-oriented control (FOC) when encoder available.
    Operating modes:
          Profile Position Mode (PPM)
          Profile Velocity Mode (PVM)
          Homing Mode (HM)
          Cyclic Synchronous Position Mode (CSP)
          Cyclic Synchronous Velocity Mode (CSV)
          Cyclic Synchronous Torque Mode (CST)
          Interpolated Position Mode (Linear, PT, PVT)
          Electronic cam (ECAM)
    Electronic gears (EGEAR)
    Pulse/Direction Mode
    Control of position, speed, current or voltage via interpolation tables, analogue or online commands
    EasyMotion Studio-Software:
        Graphic programming interface with many functions and wizards for simple commissioning, configuration and local programming of complex sequence programs in single-axis or multi-axis systems.
          Enables the selection of motor type, encoder interface and control structure as well as the setting of protection and controller parameters.
          Automatic determination of the PID controller parameters (autotuning).
          Extended analysis and optimization tools integrated using the control panels, loggers and scope functionalities.
    TML Library: The TML Motion Libraries can work under Windows (32-bit and 64-bit versions available), or Linux operating system and can be included in an application developed under C/C++, C#, Visual Basic, Delphi Pascal, or LabVIEW. TML_Lib is a collection of high-level functions allowing to control, from a PC, the Technosoft intelligent drives and motors. The protocol is TML and communication can take place via RS232, CAN bus, Ethernet or USB.
    Technosoft Motion Language (TML) programming language: Using the TML language, different operating modes, movement profiles, reference runs or the control of complex sequence programs can be graphically programmed and executed autonomously. The drive controllers can process analog and digital I / O signals, perform arithmetic and logical operations, and also exchange data and commands between the axes. Single-axis and multi-axis stand-alone applications can be easily implemented with self-created sequence programs, even without the use of a complex CANopen or EtherCAT master controller.
    MotionChip ™ technology: The main core of all Technosoft servo controllers is the MotionChip ™ - an intelligent, freely programmable motion controller specially designed for complex motion control tasks. The MotionChip ™ offers the possibility to use the powerful digital signal processors (DSP) from Texas Instruments as an independent, intelligent unit. As a result, many tasks of a complex master control are solved directly by the MotionChip ™, so that the global function of a machine is relieved and the management of a master application can be optimized. All-important control functions of a controller such as a multitude of operating modes, PLC properties, protection and safety functions as well as support for the different interface and motor technologies are accommodated on the MotionChip ™, thus enabling flexible use in a wide variety of drive systems.

    Motor supply / logic supply: 9 – 36 VDC
    Output current: 4 A continuous; 10 A peak current
    Communication via RS232, CAN/CANopen (standard) or EtherCAT (optional)
    PCIe plug-in module with very high integration density
    Flexible integration on single or multi-axis motherboards
    Size (L x W x H): 46.5 x 19.2 x 8.5 mm

  • Product Details Datasheets Documentation/Software Connection Diagrams Contact Us

  • Intelligent control of DC motors, PMSM / BLDC motors and stepper motors with very high integration density in PCIe plug-in card format. The iPOS3604 is a very compact, freely programmable servo controller with an integrated output stage, MotionChip ™ controller, I / O signals and CAN bus interface in one unit. The iPOS3604 is designed as a PCIe plug-in module for integration on a carrier board and enables easy integration even in confined spaces. Multiple VX modules can be plugged into a single motherboard, which ultimately leads to a compact design, time savings and cost optimization.
    Electrical characteristics:
          Supply voltage for logic / power: 9 - 36 VDC
          Output current: 4 A continuous, 10 A peak current
    Motor types:
          Brushless DC motors (BLDC, PMSM motors)
          Brushed DC motors (DC motors)
          Stepper motors (2- or 3-phase)
          Voice coil actuators
          Linear motors
    Feedback options:
          Incremental encoder
          SinCos 1Vpp
          Absolute encoders (optional)
          Digital Hall-sensors
          Analog Hall-sensors
    Control:
          Via CAN Bus, pulse and direction or analog/digital inputs
          Autonomous execution of complex motion sequences stored in the nonvolatile memory of the drive.
    Communication:
          RS232 - up to 115 Kbit/s
          CANopen - according to CiA profiles 301, 305 and 402
          TMLCAN - Technosoft proprietary CAN protocol
          EtherCAT - with CANopen over EtherCAT (CoE) protocol
          Ethernet - optional via an additional communication module
    Digital and analog inputs/outputs:
          5 digital inputs: 5-36 V, NPN /span>
          4 digital outputs: 5-36 V, 0.5 A, NPN Open-Collector
          2 analog input: 12 bit, 0-5 V
          Possibility to use a digital output for controlling an external motor/holding brake
          Integrated brake chopper function for controlling an external braking resistor
    Safety: • Protection against over-current, under-voltage and over-voltage, short circuit, I2t, tracking error and current limitation
    Control features:
          Sinusoidal commutation with field-oriented control (FOC) via encoder, Hall sensors or sensorless.
          Fast and accurate control loop structure with customizable sampling rate and PWM frequency up to 100KHz
          Outstanding resonance and vibration suppression through the flexible, simultaneous use of 2 BiQuad filters.
          Closed-loop with sinusoidal commutation and field-oriented control (FOC) when encoder available.
          Open loop with up to 512 microsteps per full step, step loss detection and automatic position compensation when encoder available on the load.
    Operating modes:
          Position, speed and torque control
          Path generator with trapezoidal and sinusoidal ramps
          Profile Position Mode, Velocity Mode, Homing Mode
          Interpolated position with linear (PT) and cubic splines (PVT)
          Cyclic Synchronous Position (CSP), Velocity (CSV), Torque (CST)
          Electronic gears (EGEAR) and cams (ECAM)
          Motion contouring via position, speed, torque or voltage
          Analogue external reference, pulse and direction
    EasyMotion Studio-Software:
        Graphic programming interface with many functions and wizards for simple commissioning, configuration and local programming of complex sequence programs in single-axis or multi-axis systems.
          Enables the selection of motor type, encoder interface and control structure as well as the setting of protection and controller parameters.
          Automatic determination of the PID controller parameters (autotuning).
          Extended analysis and optimization tools integrated using the control panels, loggers and scope functionalities.
    TML Library: The TML Motion Libraries can work under Windows (32-bit and 64-bit versions available), or Linux operating system and can be included in an application developed under C/C++, C#, Visual Basic, Delphi Pascal, or LabVIEW. TML_Lib is a collection of high-level functions allowing to control, from a PC, the Technosoft intelligent drives and motors. The protocol is TML and communication can take place via RS232, CAN bus, Ethernet or USB.
    Technosoft Motion Language (TML) programming language: Using the TML language, different operating modes, movement profiles, reference runs or the control of complex sequence programs can be graphically programmed and executed autonomously. The drive controllers can process analog and digital I / O signals, perform arithmetic and logical operations, and also exchange data and commands between the axes. Single-axis and multi-axis stand-alone applications can be easily implemented with self-created sequence programs, even without the use of a complex CANopen or EtherCAT master controller.
    MotionChip ™ technology: The main core of all Technosoft servo controllers is the MotionChip ™ - an intelligent, freely programmable motion controller specially designed for complex motion control tasks. The MotionChip ™ offers the possibility to use the powerful digital signal processors (DSP) from Texas Instruments as an independent, intelligent unit. As a result, many tasks of a complex master control are solved directly by the MotionChip ™, so that the global function of a machine is relieved and the management of a master application can be optimized. All-important control functions of a controller such as a multitude of operating modes, PLC properties, protection and safety functions as well as support for the different interface and motor technologies are accommodated on the MotionChip ™, thus enabling flexible use in a wide variety of drive systems.

  • Micro 4803 CZ 7-48V 4ARMS EtherCAT/CANopen

  • Intelligent, compact and freely programmable motor controller
    Brushless rotary and linear motors, voice coils and DC brushed motors
    Motor supply / logic supply: 7 – 48 VDC / 6 – 48 VDC
    Output current: 5.6 A (4ARMS) nominal; 14 A (10ARMS) peak
    Communication via RS232, USB + EtherCAT (CZ-CAT) or CAN/CANopen (CZ-CAN)
    Size (L x W x H): 38.1 x 25 x 9.5 mm

  • Product Details Datasheets Documentation/Software Connection Diagrams Contact Us

  • The Micro 4803 CZ drives are part of a new family of ultra compact intelligent servo drives, offering unprecedented drive performance combined with an embedded motion controller. Designed as a stand-alone, ready to use product, these drives offer an ideal solution for various applications with critical room conditions. Suitable for control of brushless rotary and linear motors, voice coils and DC brushed motors the Micro 4803 drives accept as position feedback incremental encoders, linear Hall sensors as well as absolute encoders such as SSI, BiSS-C, EnDAT, Tamagawa, Panasonic, Nikon and Sanyo Denki.
    Electrical characteristics:
          Motor supply / logic supply: 7 – 48 VDC / 6 – 48 VDC
          Output current: 5.6 A (4ARMS) nominal; 14 A (10ARMS) peak

          Voice coil actuators
          Linear and Torque motors

                Panasonic

                Panasonic
                Tamagawa
                Nikon
                Sanyo Denki
                EnDat 2.2

          Digital Hall sensors
          Analog (linear) Hall sensors
    Control:
          Via EtherCAT Bus, pulse and direction or analog/digital inputs
          Autonomous execution of complex motion sequences stored in the nonvolatile memory of the drive.
    Communication:
          USB
          RS232
          EtherCAT - supports the following protocols with cycle times down to 100 µs (10 kHz):
                CANopen over EtherCAT (CoE)
                File over EtherCAT (FoE) enables the transfer of setup data and firmware updates.
                Ethernet over EtherCAT (EoE), allows EasyMotion Studio to communicate with the iPOS controllers via Technosoft`s proprietary protocol.
    Digital and analog inputs/outputs:
          3 digital inputs: 5-50 V, NPN
          3 I/Os configurable either as digital inputs (5-50 V, NPN) or as digital outputs (1x 1.5 A and 2 x 0.1 A, NPN)
          1 analog input: 12 bit ±10V or 12-bit 0-5V: Reference, Feedback or general purpose
          Possibility to use a digital output for controlling an external motor/holding brake
          Integrated brake chopper function for controlling an external braking resistor
    Safety:
          Protection against over-current, over-temperature, under-voltage and over-voltage, I2t and following error.
    Control features:
          Sinusoidal commutation with field-oriented control (FOC) via encoder, Hall sensors or sensorless.
          Fast and accurate control loop structure with customizable sampling rate and PWM frequency up to 100KHz
          Outstanding resonance and vibration suppression through the flexible, simultaneous use of up to 10 notch, low-, high- or band-pass filters.
          Gain scheduling for dynamic adjustment of the PID controller parameters for optimal positioning performance.
          Dual loop with simultaneous evaluation of two different feedback sensors to compensate for gear backlash and mechanical elasticities.
    Operating modes:
          Position, speed and torque control
          Path generator with trapezoidal and sinusoidal ramps
          Profile Position Mode, Velocity Mode, Homing Mode
          Interpolated position with linear (PT) and cubic splines (PVT)
          Cyclic Synchronous Position (CSP), Velocity (CSV), Torque (CST)
          Electronic gears (EGEAR) and cams (ECAM)
          Motion contouring via position, speed, torque or voltage
          Analogue external reference, pulse and direction
    EasyMotion Studio-Software:
        Graphic programming interface with many functions and wizards for simple commissioning, configuration and local programming of complex sequence programs in single-axis or multi-axis systems.
          Enables the selection of motor type, encoder interface and control structure as well as the setting of protection and controller parameters.
          Automatic determination of the PID controller parameters (autotuning).
          Extended analysis and optimization tools integrated using the control panels, loggers and scope functionalities.
    Technosoft Motion Language (TML) programming language: Using the TML language, different operating modes, movement profiles, reference runs or the control of complex sequence programs can be graphically programmed and executed autonomously. The drive controllers can process analog and digital I / O signals, perform arithmetic and logical operations, and also exchange data and commands between the axes. Single-axis and multi-axis stand-alone applications can be easily implemented with self-created sequence programs, even without the use of a complex CANopen or EtherCAT master controller.
    MotionChip ™ technology: The main core of all Technosoft servo controllers is the MotionChip ™ - an intelligent, freely programmable motion controller specially designed for complex motion control tasks. The MotionChip ™ offers the possibility to use the powerful digital signal processors (DSP) as intelligent unit. As a result, many tasks of a complex master control are solved directly by the MotionChip ™, so that the global function of a machine is relieved and the management of a master application can be optimized. All-important control functions of a controller such as a multitude of operating modes, PLC properties, protection and safety functions as well as support for the different interface and motor technologies are accommodated on the MotionChip ™, thus enabling flexible use in a wide variety of drive systems.

Micro 4803 CZ 7-48V 4ARMS EtherCAT/CANopen
Intelligent, compact and freely programmable motor controller
Brushless rotary and linear motors, voice coils and DC brushed motors
Motor supply / logic supply: 7 – 48 VDC / 6 – 48 VDC
Output current: 5.6 A (4ARMS) nominal; 14 A (10ARMS) peak
Communication via RS232, USB + EtherCAT (CZ-CAT) or CAN/CANopen (CZ-CAN)

Product Details
Datasheets

The Micro 4803 CZ drives are part of a new family of ultra compact intelligent servo drives, offering unprecedented drive performance combined with an embedded motion controller. Designed as a stand-alone, ready to use product, these drives offer an ideal solution for various applications with critical room conditions.  Suitable for control of brushless rotary and linear motors, voice coils and DC brushed motors the Micro 4803 drives accept as position feedback incremental encoders, linear Hall sensors as well as absolute encoders such as SSI, BiSS-C, EnDAT, Tamagawa, Panasonic, Nikon and Sanyo Denki.
Electrical characteristics:
Motor supply / logic supply: 7 – 48 VDC / 6 – 48 VDC
Output current: 5.6 A (4ARMS) nominal; 14 A (10ARMS) peak
Motor types:
Brushless DC motors (BLDC, PMSM motors)
Brushed DC motors (DC motors)
Voice coil actuators
Linear and Torque motors
Feedback options:
1st Feedback:
Incremental encoder
SSI / BiSS-C

Sanyo Denki
EnDat 2.2
Hall sensors:
Digital Hall sensors
Analog (linear) Hall sensors
Control:
Via EtherCAT Bus, pulse and direction or analog/digital inputs
Autonomous execution of complex motion sequences stored in the nonvolatile memory of the drive.
Communication:
USB
RS232
EtherCAT - supports the following protocols with cycle times down to 100 µs (10 kHz):
CANopen over EtherCAT (CoE)
File over EtherCAT (FoE) enables the transfer of setup data and firmware updates.
Ethernet over EtherCAT (EoE), allows EasyMotion Studio to communicate with the iPOS controllers via Technosoft`s proprietary protocol.
Digital and analog inputs/outputs:
3 digital inputs: 5-50 V, NPN
3 I/Os configurable either as digital inputs (5-50 V, NPN) or as digital outputs (1x 1.5 A and 2 x 0.1 A, NPN)
1 analog input: 12 bit ±10V or 12-bit 0-5V: Reference, Feedback or general purpose
Possibility to use a digital output for controlling an external motor/holding brake
Integrated brake chopper function for controlling an external braking resistor
Safety:
Protection against over-current, over-temperature, under-voltage and over-voltage, I2t and following error.
Control features:
Sinusoidal commutation with field-oriented control (FOC) via encoder, Hall sensors or sensorless.
Fast and accurate control loop structure with customizable sampling rate and PWM frequency up to 100KHz
Outstanding resonance and vibration suppression through the flexible, simultaneous use of up to 10 notch, low-, high- or band-pass filters.
Gain scheduling for dynamic adjustment of the PID controller parameters for optimal positioning performance.
Dual loop with simultaneous evaluation of two different feedback sensors to compensate for gear backlash and mechanical elasticities.
Operating modes:
Position, speed and torque control
Path generator with trapezoidal and sinusoidal ramps
Profile Position Mode, Velocity Mode, Homing Mode
Interpolated position with linear (PT) and cubic splines (PVT)
Cyclic Synchronous Position (CSP), Velocity (CSV), Torque (CST)
Electronic gears (EGEAR) and cams (ECAM)
Motion contouring via position, speed, torque or voltage
Analogue external reference, pulse and direction
EasyMotion Studio-Software:
Graphic programming interface with many functions and wizards for simple commissioning, configuration and local programming of complex sequence programs in single-axis or multi-axis systems.
Enables the selection of motor type, encoder interface and control structure as well as the setting of protection and controller parameters.
Automatic determination of the PID controller parameters (autotuning).
Extended analysis and optimization tools integrated using the control panels, loggers and scope functionalities.
Technosoft Motion Language (TML) programming language:
Using the TML language, different operating modes, movement profiles, reference runs or the control of complex sequence programs can be graphically programmed and executed autonomously. The drive controllers can process analog and digital I / O signals, perform arithmetic and logical operations, and also exchange data and commands between the axes. Single-axis and multi-axis stand-alone applications can be easily implemented with self-created sequence programs, even without the use of a complex CANopen or EtherCAT master controller.
MotionChip ™ technology:
The main core of all Technosoft servo controllers is the MotionChip ™ - an intelligent, freely programmable motion controller specially designed for complex motion control tasks. The MotionChip ™ offers the possibility to use the powerful digital signal processors (DSP) as intelligent unit. As a result, many tasks of a complex master control are solved directly by the MotionChip ™, so that the global function of a machine is relieved and the management of a master application can be optimized. All-important control functions of a controller such as a multitude of operating modes, PLC properties, protection and safety functions as well as support for the different interface and motor technologies are accommodated on the MotionChip ™, thus enabling flexible use in a wide variety of drive systems.

As a result, many tasks of a complex master control are solved directly by the MotionChip ™, so that the global function of a machine is relieved and the management of a master application can be optimized.   • Ultra-compact 4-quadrant controller for controlling brushed DC motors, brushless DC motors and stepper motors with an output of up to 24 watts. The iPOS2401 is an intelligent, freely programmable servo controller with an integrated output stage, MotionChip ™ controller, I / O signals and EtherCAT interface in one unit. The iPOS2401 is designed as a module for soldering / plugging in and offers an ideal solution for various applications with critical space requirements.

          Autonomous execution of complex motion sequences stored in the nonvolatile memory of the drive.

          EtherCAT - with CANopen over EtherCAT (CoE) protocol
    Digital and analog inputs/outputs:
          5 digital inputs: 5-24 V, NPN

          1 analog input: 12 bit, 0-5 V
          Possibility to use a digital output for controlling an external motor/holding brake

          Fast and accurate control loop structure with customizable sampling rate and PWM frequency up to 120KHz
          Outstanding resonance and vibration suppression through the flexible, simultaneous use of 2 BiQuad filters.
          Closed-loop with sinusoidal commutation and field-oriented control (FOC) when encoder available.
          Open loop with up to 512 microsteps per full step, step loss detection and automatic position compensation when encoder available on the load.
    Operating modes:
          Position, speed and torque control
          Path generator with trapezoidal and sinusoidal ramps
          Profile Position Mode, Velocity Mode, Homing Mode
          Interpolated position with linear (PT) and cubic splines (PVT)
          Cyclic Synchronous Position (CSP), Velocity (CSV), Torque (CST)
          Electronic gears (EGEAR) and cams (ECAM)
          Motion contouring via position, speed, torque or voltage
          Analogue external reference, pulse and direction
    EasyMotion Studio-Software:
        Graphic programming interface with many functions and wizards for simple commissioning, configuration and local programming of complex sequence programs in single-axis or multi-axis systems.
          Enables the selection of motor type, encoder interface and control structure as well as the setting of protection and controller parameters.
          Automatic determination of the PID controller parameters (autotuning).
          Extended analysis and optimization tools integrated using the control panels, loggers and scope functionalities.
    Technosoft Motion Language (TML) programming language: Using the TML language, different operating modes, movement profiles, reference runs or the control of complex sequence programs can be graphically programmed and executed autonomously. The drive controllers can process analog and digital I / O signals, perform arithmetic and logical operations, and also exchange data and commands between the axes. Single-axis and multi-axis stand-alone applications can be easily implemented with self-created sequence programs, even without the use of a complex CANopen or EtherCAT master controller.
    MotionChip ™ technology: The main core of all Technosoft servo controllers is the MotionChip ™ - an intelligent, freely programmable motion controller specially designed for complex motion control tasks. The MotionChip ™ offers the possibility to use the powerful digital signal processors (DSP) from Texas Instruments as an independent, intelligent unit. As a result, many tasks of a complex master control are solved directly by the MotionChip ™, so that the global function of a machine is relieved and the management of a master application can be optimized. All-important control functions of a controller such as a multitude of operating modes, PLC properties, protection and safety functions as well as support for the different interface and motor technologies are accommodated on the MotionChip ™, thus enabling flexible use in a wide variety of drive systems.

Ultra-compact 4-quadrant controller for controlling brushed DC motors, brushless DC motors and stepper motors with an output of up to 24 watts. The iPOS2401 is an intelligent, freely programmable servo controller with an integrated output stage, MotionChip ™ controller, I / O signals and EtherCAT interface in one unit. The iPOS2401 is designed as a module for soldering / plugging in and offers an ideal solution for various applications with critical space requirements.
Electrical characteristics:
Supply voltage for logic / power: 7-40 VDC / 7-30 VDC
Output current: 0.9 A continuous / peak current
Motor types:
Brushless DC motors (BLDC, PMSM motors)
Brushed DC motors (DC motors)
Stepper motors (2- or 3-phase)
Voice coil actuators
Linear motors
Feedback options:
Incremental encoder
Absolute encoders (optional)
Digital Hall-sensors
Analog Hall-sensors
Control:
Via EtherCAT Bus, pulse and direction or analog/digital inputs
Autonomous execution of complex motion sequences stored in the nonvolatile memory of the drive.
Communication:
RS232 - up to 115 Kbit/s
EtherCAT - with CANopen over EtherCAT (CoE) protocol
Digital and analog inputs/outputs:
5 digital inputs: 5-24 V, NPN
2 digital outputs: 5-24 V, 0.5 A, NPN Open-Collector
1 analog input: 12 bit, 0-5 V
Possibility to use a digital output for controlling an external motor/holding brake
Integrated brake chopper function for controlling an external brake resistance
Safety:
Protection against over-current, over-temperature, under-voltage and over-voltage, I2t and following error.
Control features:
Sinusoidal commutation with field-oriented control (FOC) via encoder, Hall sensors or sensorless.
Fast and accurate control loop structure with customizable sampling rate and PWM frequency up to 120KHz
Outstanding resonance and vibration suppression through the flexible, simultaneous use of 2 BiQuad filters.
Closed-loop with sinusoidal commutation and field-oriented control (FOC) when encoder available.
Open loop with up to 512 microsteps per full step, step loss detection and automatic position compensation when encoder available on the load.
Operating modes:
Position, speed and torque control
Path generator with trapezoidal and sinusoidal ramps
Profile Position Mode, Velocity Mode, Homing Mode
Interpolated position with linear (PT) and cubic splines (PVT)
Cyclic Synchronous Position (CSP), Velocity (CSV), Torque (CST)
Electronic gears (EGEAR) and cams (ECAM)
Motion contouring via position, speed, torque or voltage
Analogue external reference, pulse and direction
EasyMotion Studio-Software:
Graphic programming interface with many functions and wizards for simple commissioning, configuration and local programming of complex sequence programs in single-axis or multi-axis systems.
Enables the selection of motor type, encoder interface and control structure as well as the setting of protection and controller parameters.
Automatic determination of the PID controller parameters (autotuning).
Extended analysis and optimization tools integrated using the control panels, loggers and scope functionalities.
Technosoft Motion Language (TML) programming language:
Using the TML language, different operating modes, movement profiles, reference runs or the control of complex sequence programs can be graphically programmed and executed autonomously. The drive controllers can process analog and digital I / O signals, perform arithmetic and logical operations, and also exchange data and commands between the axes. Single-axis and multi-axis stand-alone applications can be easily implemented with self-created sequence programs, even without the use of a complex CANopen or EtherCAT master controller.
MotionChip ™ technology:
The main core of all Technosoft servo controllers is the MotionChip ™ - an intelligent, freely programmable motion controller specially designed for complex motion control tasks. The MotionChip ™ offers the possibility to use the powerful digital signal processors (DSP) from Texas Instruments as an independent, intelligent unit. As a result, many tasks of a complex master control are solved directly by the MotionChip ™, so that the global function of a machine is relieved and the management of a master application can be optimized. All-important control functions of a controller such as a multitude of operating modes, PLC properties, protection and safety functions as well as support for the different interface and motor technologies are accommodated on the MotionChip ™, thus enabling flexible use in a wide variety of drive systems.

  • Intelligent control of DC motors, PMSM / BLDC motors and stepper motors with very high integration density. The iPOS3602 is a very compact, freely programmable servo controller with an integrated output stage, MotionChip ™ controller, I / O signals and CAN bus interface in one unit. The iPOS3602 MX is designed as a module for soldering / plugging into a carrier board and offers an ideal solution for various applications with critical room conditions. The extremely compact design offers easy integration in the smallest of spaces.
    Electrical characteristics:
          Supply voltage for logic / power: 9 - 36 VDC
          Output current: 4 A continuous, 10 A peak current
    Motor types:
          Brushless DC motors (BLDC, PMSM motors)
          Brushed DC motors (DC motors)

          Voice coil actuators
          Linear motors

          Analog Hall-sensors

          Autonomous execution of complex motion sequences stored in the nonvolatile memory of the drive.

          CANopen - according to CiA profiles 301, 305 and 402
          TMLCAN - Technosoft proprietary CAN protocol
          EtherCAT - with CANopen over EtherCAT (CoE) protocol
          Ethernet - optional via an additional communication module
    Digital and analog inputs/outputs:

          1 analog input: 12 bit, 0-5 V
          Possibility to use a digital output for controlling an external motor/holding brake
          Integrated brake chopper function for controlling an external braking resistor

          Outstanding resonance and vibration suppression through the flexible, simultaneous use of 2 BiQuad filters.

          Open loop with up to 512 microsteps per full step, step loss detection and automatic position compensation when encoder available on the load.

          Path generator with trapezoidal and sinusoidal ramps

          Enables the selection of motor type, encoder interface and control structure as well as the setting of protection and controller parameters.
          Automatic determination of the PID controller parameters (autotuning).
          Extended analysis and optimization tools integrated using the control panels, loggers and scope functionalities.
    TML Library: The TML Motion Libraries can work under Windows (32-bit and 64-bit versions available), or Linux operating system and can be included in an application developed under C/C++, C#, Visual Basic, Delphi Pascal, or LabVIEW. TML_Lib is a collection of high-level functions allowing to control, from a PC, the Technosoft intelligent drives and motors. The protocol is TML and communication can take place via RS232, CAN bus, Ethernet or USB.
    Technosoft Motion Language (TML) programming language: Using the TML language, different operating modes, movement profiles, reference runs or the control of complex sequence programs can be graphically programmed and executed autonomously. The drive controllers can process analog and digital I / O signals, perform arithmetic and logical operations, and also exchange data and commands between the axes. Single-axis and multi-axis stand-alone applications can be easily implemented with self-created sequence programs, even without the use of a complex CANopen or EtherCAT master controller.

The MotionChip ™ offers the possibility to use the powerful digital signal processors (DSP) from Texas Instruments as an independent, intelligent unit. As a result, many tasks of a complex master control are solved directly by the MotionChip ™, so that the global function of a machine is relieved and the management of a master application can be optimized. All-important control functions of a controller such as a multitude of operating modes, PLC properties, protection and safety functions as well as support for the different interface and motor technologies are accommodated on the MotionChip ™, thus enabling flexible use in a wide variety of drive systems.

  • iPOS4810 MZ-CAT 11-50V 10ARMS 700W EtherCAT

  • Intelligent, compact and freely programmable motor controller
    For brushless rotary and linear motors, voice coils, DC brush and step motors
    Motor supply / logic supply / STO supply: 11 – 50 VDC / 9 – 36 VDC / 18-40VDC
    Output current: 14.1A (10ARMS) nominal; 40A (28.3ARMS) peak
    Communication via , USB, LV-TTL UART, or EtherCAT
    STO inputs with safety integrity level SIL3/Cat3/PLe
    Size (L x W x H): 64 x 43.6 x 13.7 mm

  • Product Details Datasheets Documentation/Software Connection Diagrams Contact Us

  • The iPOS4810 MZ-CAT is part of a new family of intelligent servo drives, offering unprecedented drive performance combined with an embedded motion controller.Designed as a module for soldering / plugging into a carrier board this drive offers an ideal solution for various applications. Suitable for control of brushless rotary and linear motors, voice coils, DC brushed and step motors, iPOS4810 MZ drives accept as position feedback incremental encoders, linear Hall sensors as well as absolute encoders such as SSI, BiSS-C, EnDAT 2.2, Tamagawa, Panasonic, Nikon and Sanyo Denki.
    Electrical characteristics:
          Motor supply / logic supply / STO supply: 11 – 50 VDC / 9 – 36 VDC / 18-40VDC
          Output current:14.1A (10ARMS) nominal; 40A (28.3ARMS) peak
    Motor types:
          Brushless and servo motors (BLDC, PMSM)
          Brushed DC motors
          Stepper motors (2- or 3-phase)
          Voice coil actuators
          Linear motors
    Feedback options:
          1st Feedback:
                Incremental digital encoder
                Incremental SinCos 1Vpp encoder
          2nd Feedback:
                Incremental digital encoder
                Absolute encoders SSI / BiSS-C / EnDat 2.2 / Tamagawa / Panasonic / Nikon / Sanyo Denki
    Hall sensors:
               Digital Hall-sensors
               Analog(linear) Hall-sensors
    Control
               Via EtherCAT Bus, pulse and direction or analog/digital inputs
               Autonomous execution of complex motion sequences stored in the nonvolatile memory of the drive
    Communication:
          USB (Virtual COM port)
          RS232(external transceiver needed)- up to 921.6 Kbit/s
          CANopen over EtherCAT (CoE)
          File over EtherCAT (FoE) – enables the transfer of setup data and firmware updates.
          Ethernet - optional via an additEthernet over EtherCAT (EoE) – allows EasyMotion Studio to communicate with zhe iPOS controller via Technosoft’s proprietary protocol
    Digital and analog inputs/outputs:
          6 digital inputs: 12-36 V, PNP/NPN programmable
          5 digital outputs: 5-36 V, PNP/NPN programmable
          1 digital output: 5-36V, PNP/NPN programmable, 1.6A PNP / 2A NPN for controlling an external motor/holding brake
          2 analog inputs: 12 bit, 0-5 V
    Safety:
          Protection against over-current, over-temperature, under-voltage and over-voltage, I2t and following error.
          STO - Safe Torque Off with safety integrity level SIL 3, category 3, PLe.
    Control features:
          Sinusoidal commutation with field-oriented control (FOC) via encoder, Hall sensors or sensorless.
          Fast and accurate cascaded control loops with customizable sampling rates and PWM switching frequency
          Resonance and vibration suppression using up to 10 BiQuad filters configurable as notch, low-pass, high-pass or band-pass..
          Gain scheduling for dynamic adjustment of the PID controller parameters for optimal positioning performance.
          Dual loop with simultaneous use of two different feedback sensors to compensate for gear backlash and mechanical elasticities.
          Closed-loop stepper control with sinusoidal commutation and field-oriented control (FOC) when an encoder is mounted on the motor shaft.
          Open loop stepper control with up to 512 microsteps per full step, step loss detection and automatic position compensation when encoder available on the load.
    Operating modes:
          Position, speed and torque control
          Path generator with trapezoidal and sinusoidal ramps
          Profile Position Mode, Velocity Mode, Homing Mode
          Interpolated position with linear (PT) and cubic splines (PVT)
          Cyclic Synchronous Position (CSP) Velocity (CSV), Torque (CST)
          Electronic gear and cam
          Motion contouring via position, speed, torque or voltage
          External reference: analogue, pulse and direction or on-line commands
    EasyMotion Studio-Software:
        Graphic programming interface with many functions and wizards for simple commissioning, configuration and local programming of complex sequence programs in single-axis or multi-axis systems.
          Enables the selection of motor type, encoder interface and control structure as well as the setting of protection and controller parameters.
          Automatic determination of the PID controller parameters (autotuning).
          Extended analysis and optimization tools integrated using the control panels, loggers and scope functionalities.
    Technosoft Motion Language (TML) programming language: Using the TML language, different operating modes, movement profiles, reference runs or the control of complex sequence programs can be graphically programmed and executed autonomously. The drive controllers can process analog and digital I / O signals, perform arithmetic and logical operations, and also exchange data and commands between the axes. Single-axis and multi-axis stand-alone applications can be easily implemented with self-created sequence programs, even without the use of a complex CANopen or EtherCAT master controller.
    TML Library: The TML Motion Libraries can work under Windows (32-bit and 64-bit versions available), or Linux operating system and can be included in an application developed under C/C++, C#, Visual Basic, Delphi Pascal, or LabVIEW. TML_Lib is a collection of high-level functions allowing to control, from a PC, the Technosoft intelligent drives and motors. The protocol is TML and communication can take place via RS232, CAN bus, Ethernet or USB.
    MotionChip ™ technology: The main core of all Technosoft servo controllers is the MotionChip ™ - an intelligent, freely programmable motion controller specially designed for complex motion control tasks. The MotionChip ™ offers the possibility to use the powerful digital signal processors (DSP) from Texas Instruments as an independent, intelligent unit. As a result, many tasks of a complex master control are solved directly by the MotionChip ™, so that the global function of a machine is relieved and the management of a master application can be optimized. All-important control functions of a controller such as a multitude of operating modes, PLC properties, protection and safety functions as well as support for the different interface and motor technologies are accommodated on the MotionChip ™, thus enabling flexible use in a wide variety of drive systems.

iPOS4810 MZ-CAT 11-50V 10ARMS 700W EtherCAT
Intelligent, compact and freely programmable motor controller
For brushless rotary and linear motors, voice coils, DC brush and step motors
Motor supply / logic supply / STO supply: 11 – 50 VDC / 9 – 36 VDC / 18-40VDC
Output current: 14.1A (10ARMS) nominal; 40A (28.3ARMS) peak
Communication via , USB, LV-TTL UART, or EtherCAT
STO inputs with safety integrity level SIL3/Cat3/PLe
Size (L x W x H): 64 x 43.6 x 13.7 mm
Product Details
Datasheets
Documentation/Software
Connection Diagrams
Contact Us
The iPOS4810 MZ-CAT is part of a new family of intelligent servo drives, offering unprecedented drive performance combined with an embedded motion controller.Designed as a module for soldering / plugging into a carrier board this drive offers an ideal solution for various applications. Suitable for control of brushless rotary and linear motors, voice coils, DC brushed and step motors, iPOS4810 MZ drives accept as position feedback incremental encoders, linear Hall sensors as well as absolute encoders such as SSI, BiSS-C, EnDAT 2.2, Tamagawa, Panasonic, Nikon and Sanyo Denki.
Electrical characteristics:
Motor supply / logic supply / STO supply: 11 – 50 VDC / 9 – 36 VDC / 18-40VDC
Output current:14.1A (10ARMS) nominal; 40A (28.3ARMS) peak
Motor types:
Brushless and servo motors (BLDC, PMSM)
Brushed DC motors
Stepper motors (2- or 3-phase)
Voice coil actuators
Linear motors
Feedback options:
1st Feedback:
Incremental digital encoder
Incremental SinCos 1Vpp encoder
2nd Feedback:
Incremental digital encoder
Absolute encoders SSI / BiSS-C / EnDat 2.2 / Tamagawa / Panasonic / Nikon / Sanyo Denki
Hall sensors:
Digital Hall-sensors
Analog(linear) Hall-sensors
Control
Via EtherCAT Bus, pulse and direction or analog/digital inputs
Autonomous execution of complex motion sequences stored in the nonvolatile memory of the drive
Communication:
USB (Virtual COM port)
RS232(external transceiver needed)- up to 921.6 Kbit/s
CANopen over EtherCAT (CoE)
File over EtherCAT (FoE) – enables the transfer of setup data and firmware updates.
Ethernet - optional via an additEthernet over EtherCAT (EoE) – allows EasyMotion Studio to communicate with zhe iPOS controller via Technosoft’s proprietary protocol
Digital and analog inputs/outputs:
6 digital inputs: 12-36 V, PNP/NPN programmable
5 digital outputs: 5-36 V, PNP/NPN programmable
1 digital output: 5-36V, PNP/NPN programmable, 1.6A PNP / 2A NPN for controlling an external motor/holding brake
2 analog inputs: 12 bit, 0-5 V
Safety:
Protection against over-current, over-temperature, under-voltage and over-voltage, I2t and following error.
STO - Safe Torque Off with safety integrity level SIL 3, category 3, PLe.
Control features:
Sinusoidal commutation with field-oriented control (FOC) via encoder, Hall sensors or sensorless.
Fast and accurate cascaded control loops with customizable sampling rates and PWM switching frequency
Resonance and vibration suppression using up to 10 BiQuad filters configurable as notch, low-pass, high-pass or band-pass..
Gain scheduling for dynamic adjustment of the PID controller parameters for optimal positioning performance.
Dual loop with simultaneous use  of two different feedback sensors to compensate for gear backlash and mechanical elasticities.
Closed-loop stepper control  with sinusoidal commutation and field-oriented control (FOC) when an encoder is mounted on the motor shaft.
Open loop stepper control with up to 512 microsteps per full step, step loss detection and automatic position compensation when encoder available on the load.
Operating modes:
Position, speed and torque control
Path generator with trapezoidal and sinusoidal ramps
Profile Position Mode, Velocity Mode, Homing Mode
Interpolated position with linear (PT) and cubic splines (PVT)
Cyclic Synchronous Position (CSP) Velocity (CSV), Torque (CST)
Electronic gear and cam
Motion contouring via position, speed, torque or voltage
External reference: analogue, pulse and direction or on-line commands
EasyMotion Studio-Software:
Graphic programming interface with many functions and wizards for simple commissioning, configuration and local programming of complex sequence programs in single-axis or multi-axis systems.
Enables the selection of motor type, encoder interface and control structure as well as the setting of protection and controller parameters.
Automatic determination of the PID controller parameters (autotuning).
Extended analysis and optimization tools integrated using the control panels, loggers and scope functionalities.
Technosoft Motion Language (TML) programming language:
Using the TML language, different operating modes, movement profiles, reference runs or the control of complex sequence programs can be graphically programmed and executed autonomously. The drive controllers can process analog and digital I / O signals, perform arithmetic and logical operations, and also exchange data and commands between the axes. Single-axis and multi-axis stand-alone applications can be easily implemented with self-created sequence programs, even without the use of a complex CANopen or EtherCAT master controller.
TML Library:
The TML Motion Libraries can work under Windows (32-bit and 64-bit versions available), or Linux operating system and can be included in an application developed under C/C++, C#, Visual Basic, Delphi Pascal, or LabVIEW. TML_Lib is a collection of high-level functions allowing to control, from a PC, the Technosoft intelligent drives and motors. The protocol is TML and communication can take place via RS232, CAN bus, Ethernet or USB.
MotionChip ™ technology:
The main core of all Technosoft servo controllers is the MotionChip ™ - an intelligent, freely programmable motion controller specially designed for complex motion control tasks. The MotionChip ™ offers the possibility to use the powerful digital signal processors (DSP) from Texas Instruments as an independent, intelligent unit. As a result, many tasks of a complex master control are solved directly by the MotionChip ™, so that the global function of a machine is relieved and the management of a master application can be optimized. All-important control functions of a controller such as a multitude of operating modes, PLC properties, protection and safety functions as well as support for the different interface and motor technologies are accommodated on the MotionChip ™, thus enabling flexible use in a wide variety of drive systems.

Stepper motor with embedded drive and motion controller
Stepper motor with an integrated freely programmable servo controller
High dynamics and efficiency through field-oriented control (FOC)

Magnetic single-turn absolute encoder with 4096 I / rev. (12 bit)
Interface: EtherCAT, RS232
Connector system: M8 / M12
Product Details
Datasheets
Documentation/Software
Connection Diagrams
Contact Us
Intelligent stepper motor with embedded motion controller, position feedback, RS232 and EtherCAT interface. The integrated control system reduces the amount of wiring required for power supply and communication, and improves electromagnetic compatibility significantly. The intelligent motor is already optimally designed, ready for immediate operation and thus enables simple integration in small spaces.
Electrical characteristics:
Operating voltage: 12 - 48 VDC / nominal current: 2.8 A
Nominal torque: 1.6 Nm @ 750 rpm
No load speed: 1400 rpm @ 48 VDC
Communication:
RS232 - up to 115 Kbit/s
EtherCAT - with CANopen over EtherCAT (CoE) protocol
Digital and analog inputs/outputs:
4 digital inputs: 5-24 V, NPN or PNP configurable
2 digital outputs: 5-24 V, NPN (0.4A) or PNP (0.3A) configurable
1 analog input: 12 bit, 0-5 V
Feedback:
Integrated magnetic single-turn absolute encoder with a resolution of 4096 increments per revolution (12 bit).
Safety:
Protection against over-current, over-temperature, under-voltage and over-voltage, I2t and following error.
Control features:
Via EtherCAT bus or analog / digital inputs
Through autonomous execution of complex motion sequences directly from the non-volatile memory of the integrated controller
Operation modes:
Closed-loop with sinusoidal commutation and field-oriented control (FOC) when the integrated encoder is enabled
Open loop with up to 512 microsteps per full step, step loss detection and automatic position compensation when encoder available on the load
Operating modes:
Position, speed and torque control
Trajectory generator with trapezoidal and sinusoidal ramps
Profile Position Mode, Velocity Mode, Homing Mode
Profile Position Mode, Velocity Mode, Homing Mode
Cyclic Synchronous Position (CSP), Velocity (CSV), Torque (CST)
Electronic gears (EGEAR) and cams (ECAM)
Motion contouring via position, speed, torque or voltage
Analogue external reference, pulse and direction
EasyMotion Studio software:
Graphic programming interface with many wizards for simple commissioning, configuration and local programming of complex sequence programs in single-axis or multi-axis systems
Straightforward selection of motor type, encoder interface and control structure as well as the configuration of the protections and controller parameters
Automatic determination of the PID controller parameters (autotuning)
Extended analysis and optimization tools integrated using the control panels, loggers and scope functionalities
Technosoft Motion Language (TML) :
Using the TML language, different operating modes, movement profiles, reference runs or the control of complex sequence programs can be graphically programmed and executed autonomously. The drive controllers can process analog and digital I / O signals, perform arithmetic and logical operations, and also exchange data and commands between the axes. Single-axis and multi-axis stand-alone applications can be easily implemented with self-created sequence programs, even without the use of a complex CANopen or EtherCAT master controller.
MotionChip ™ technology:
The main core of all Technosoft servo controllers is the MotionChip ™ - an intelligent, freely programmable motion controller specially designed for complex motion control tasks. The MotionChip ™ offers the possibility to use the powerful digital signal processors (DSP) from Texas Instruments as an independent, intelligent unit. As a result, many tasks of a complex master control are solved directly by the MotionChip ™, so that the global function of a machine is relieved and the management of a master application can be optimized. All-important control functions of a controller such as a multitude of operating modes, PLC properties, protection and safety functions as well as support for the different interface and motor technologies are accommodated on the MotionChip ™, thus enabling flexible use in a wide variety of drive systems.

  • Intelligent, compact and freely programmable motor controller
    For brushless, DC brush and step motors
    Motor supply / logic supply: 9 – 36 VDC
    Output current: 4 A continuous; 10 A peak current
    Communication via RS232, TMLCAN and CANopen interfaces
    Closed-frame design, with retractable connectors
    Size (L x W x H): 80 x 55 x 16.3 mm

  • Product Details Datasheets Documentation/Software Connection Diagrams Contact Us

  • Intelligent control of DC motors, PMSM / BLDC motors and stepper motors with very high integration density. The iPOS3604 BX is a very compact, freely programmable servo controller with an integrated output stage, MotionChip ™ controller, I / O signals and CAN bus interface in one unit. The compact design allows installation even in confined spaces.
    Electrical characteristics:
          Supply voltage for logic / power: 9 - 36 VDC
          Output current: 4 A continuous, 10 A peak current
    Motor types:
          Brushless DC motors (BLDC, PMSM motors)
          Brushed DC motors (DC motors)
          Stepper motors (2- or 3-phase)
          Voice coil actuators
          Linear motors
    Feedback options:
          Incremental encoder
          SinCos 1Vpp
          Digital Hall-sensors
          Analog Hall-sensors
    Control:
          Via CAN Bus, pulse and direction or analog/digital inputs
          Autonomous execution of complex motion sequences stored in the nonvolatile memory of the drive.
    Communication:
          RS232 - up to 115 Kbit/s
          CANopen - according to CiA profiles 301, 305 and 402
          TMLCAN - Technosoft proprietary CAN protocol
          Ethernet - optional via an additional communication module
    Digital and analog inputs/outputs:
          5 digital inputs: 5-36 V, NPN or PNP configurable
          4 digital outputs: 5-36 V, 0.5 A, NPN Open-Collector
          1 analog input: 12 bit, 0-5 V
          Possibility to use a digital output for controlling an external motor/holding brake
          Integrated brake chopper function for controlling an external braking resistor
    Safety: Protection against over-current, under-voltage and over-voltage, short circuit, I2t, tracking error and current limitation
    Control features:
          Sinusoidal commutation with field-oriented control (FOC) via encoder, Hall sensors or sensorless.
          Fast and accurate control loop structure with customizable sampling rate and PWM frequency up to 100KHz
          Outstanding resonance and vibration suppression through the flexible, simultaneous use of 2 BiQuad filters.
          Closed-loop with sinusoidal commutation and field-oriented control (FOC) when encoder available.
          Open loop with up to 512 microsteps per full step, step loss detection and automatic position compensation when encoder available on the load.
    Operating modes:
          Position, speed and torque control
          Path generator with trapezoidal and sinusoidal ramps
          Profile Position Mode, Velocity Mode, Homing Mode
          Interpolated position with linear (PT) and cubic splines (PVT)
          Cyclic Synchronous Position (CSP)
          Electronic gears (EGEAR) and cams (ECAM)
          Motion contouring via position, speed, torque or voltage
          Analogue external reference, pulse and direction
    EasyMotion Studio-Software:
        Graphic programming interface with many functions and wizards for simple commissioning, configuration and local programming of complex sequence programs in single-axis or multi-axis systems.
          Enables the selection of motor type, encoder interface and control structure as well as the setting of protection and controller parameters.
          Automatic determination of the PID controller parameters (autotuning).
          Extended analysis and optimization tools integrated using the control panels, loggers and scope functionalities.
    TML Library: The TML Motion Libraries can work under Windows (32-bit and 64-bit versions available), or Linux operating system and can be included in an application developed under C/C++, C#, Visual Basic, Delphi Pascal, or LabVIEW. TML_Lib is a collection of high-level functions allowing to control, from a PC, the Technosoft intelligent drives and motors. The protocol is TML and communication can take place via RS232, CAN bus, Ethernet or USB.
    Technosoft Motion Language (TML) programming language: Using the TML language, different operating modes, movement profiles, reference runs or the control of complex sequence programs can be graphically programmed and executed autonomously. The drive controllers can process analog and digital I / O signals, perform arithmetic and logical operations, and also exchange data and commands between the axes. Single-axis and multi-axis stand-alone applications can be easily implemented with self-created sequence programs, even without the use of a complex CANopen or EtherCAT master controller.
    MotionChip ™ technology: The main core of all Technosoft servo controllers is the MotionChip ™ - an intelligent, freely programmable motion controller specially designed for complex motion control tasks. The MotionChip ™ offers the possibility to use the powerful digital signal processors (DSP) from Texas Instruments as an independent, intelligent unit. As a result, many tasks of a complex master control are solved directly by the MotionChip ™, so that the global function of a machine is relieved and the management of a master application can be optimized. All-important control functions of a controller such as a multitude of operating modes, PLC properties, protection and safety functions as well as support for the different interface and motor technologies are accommodated on the MotionChip ™, thus enabling flexible use in a wide variety of drive systems.

Intelligent, compact and freely programmable motor controller

Intelligent control of DC motors, PMSM / BLDC motors and stepper motors with very high integration density. The iPOS3604 BX is a very compact, freely programmable servo controller with an integrated output stage, MotionChip ™ controller, I / O signals and CAN bus interface in one unit. The compact design allows installation even in confined spaces.
Electrical characteristics:
Supply voltage for logic / power: 9 - 36 VDC
Output current: 4 A continuous, 10 A peak current
Motor types:
Brushless DC motors (BLDC, PMSM motors)
Brushed DC motors (DC motors)
Stepper motors (2- or 3-phase)
Voice coil actuators
Linear motors
Feedback options:
Incremental encoder
SinCos 1Vpp
Digital Hall-sensors
Analog Hall-sensors
Control:
Via CAN Bus, pulse and direction or analog/digital inputs
Autonomous execution of complex motion sequences stored in the nonvolatile memory of the drive.
Communication:
RS232 - up to 115 Kbit/s
CANopen - according to CiA profiles 301, 305 and 402
TMLCAN - Technosoft proprietary CAN protocol
Ethernet - optional via an additional communication module
Digital and analog inputs/outputs:
5 digital inputs: 5-36 V, NPN or PNP configurable
4 digital outputs: 5-36 V, 0.5 A, NPN Open-Collector
1 analog input: 12 bit, 0-5 V
Possibility to use a digital output for controlling an external motor/holding brake
Integrated brake chopper function for controlling an external braking resistor
Safety:
Protection against over-current, under-voltage and over-voltage, short circuit, I2t, tracking error and current limitation
Control features:
Sinusoidal commutation with field-oriented control (FOC) via encoder, Hall sensors or sensorless.
Fast and accurate control loop structure with customizable sampling rate and PWM frequency up to 100KHz
Outstanding resonance and vibration suppression through the flexible, simultaneous use of 2 BiQuad filters.
Closed-loop with sinusoidal commutation and field-oriented control (FOC) when encoder available.
Open loop with up to 512 microsteps per full step, step loss detection and automatic position compensation when encoder available on the load.
Operating modes:
Position, speed and torque control
Path generator with trapezoidal and sinusoidal ramps
Profile Position Mode, Velocity Mode, Homing Mode
Interpolated position with linear (PT) and cubic splines (PVT)
Cyclic Synchronous Position (CSP)
Electronic gears (EGEAR) and cams (ECAM)
Motion contouring via position, speed, torque or voltage
Analogue external reference, pulse and direction
EasyMotion Studio-Software:
Graphic programming interface with many functions and wizards for simple commissioning, configuration and local programming of complex sequence programs in single-axis or multi-axis systems.
Enables the selection of motor type, encoder interface and control structure as well as the setting of protection and controller parameters.
Automatic determination of the PID controller parameters (autotuning).
Extended analysis and optimization tools integrated using the control panels, loggers and scope functionalities.
TML Library:
The TML Motion Libraries can work under Windows (32-bit and 64-bit versions available), or Linux operating system and can be included in an application developed under C/C++, C#, Visual Basic, Delphi Pascal, or LabVIEW. TML_Lib is a collection of high-level functions allowing to control, from a PC, the Technosoft intelligent drives and motors. The protocol is TML and communication can take place via RS232, CAN bus, Ethernet or USB.
Technosoft Motion Language (TML) programming language:
Using the TML language, different operating modes, movement profiles, reference runs or the control of complex sequence programs can be graphically programmed and executed autonomously. The drive controllers can process analog and digital I / O signals, perform arithmetic and logical operations, and also exchange data and commands between the axes. Single-axis and multi-axis stand-alone applications can be easily implemented with self-created sequence programs, even without the use of a complex CANopen or EtherCAT master controller.
MotionChip ™ technology:
The main core of all Technosoft servo controllers is the MotionChip ™ - an intelligent, freely programmable motion controller specially designed for complex motion control tasks. The MotionChip ™ offers the possibility to use the powerful digital signal processors (DSP) from Texas Instruments as an independent, intelligent unit. As a result, many tasks of a complex master control are solved directly by the MotionChip ™, so that the global function of a machine is relieved and the management of a master application can be optimized. All-important control functions of a controller such as a multitude of operating modes, PLC properties, protection and safety functions as well as support for the different interface and motor technologies are accommodated on the MotionChip ™, thus enabling flexible use in a wide variety of drive systems.

          Brushless DC motors (BLDC, PMSM motors)
          Brushed DC motors (DC motors)
          Stepper motors (2- or 3-phase)
          Voice coil actuators
          Linear motors
    Feedback options:
          1st Feedback:
                Incremental encoder
                SinCos 1Vpp
                Digital Hall-sensors
                Analog Hall-sensors
          2nd Feedback:
                Incremental encoder
                SSI / BiSS-C
                EnDat 2.2
    Control:
          Via EtherCAT fieldbus, pulse and direction or analog/digital inputs
          Autonomous execution of complex motion sequences stored in the nonvolatile memory of the drive.
    Communication:
          RS232 - up to 115 Kbit/s
          EtherCAT - supports the following protocols with cycle times up to 2 kHz (500 µs):
                CANopen over EtherCAT (CoE)
                File over EtherCAT (FoE) enables the transfer of setup data and firmware updates.
                Ethernet over EtherCAT (EoE), EasyMotion Studio enables communication with the iPOS controller via Technosoft own protocol.
    Digital and analog inputs/outputs:
          6 digital inputs: 5-36 V, NPN or PNP configurable
          5 digital outputs: 5-36 V, 0.5 A, NPN Open-Collector
          2 analog input: 12 bit, 0-5 V
          Possibility to use a digital output for controlling an external motor/holding brake
          Integrated brake chopper function for controlling an external braking resistor
    Safety:
          Protection against over-current, over-temperature, under-voltage and over-voltage, I2t and following error.
          STO - Safe Torque Off with safety integrity level SIL 3, category 3, PLe.
    Control features:
          Sinusoidal commutation with field-oriented control (FOC) via encoder, Hall sensors or sensorless.
          Fast and accurate control loop structure with customizable sampling rate and PWM frequency up to 100KHz
          Outstanding resonance and vibration suppression through the flexible, simultaneous use of 10 BiQuad filters.
          Gain scheduling for dynamic adjustment of the PID controller parameters for optimal positioning performance.
          Dual loop with simultaneous evaluation of two different feedback sensors to compensate for gear backlash and mechanical elasticities.
          Closed-loop with sinusoidal commutation and field-oriented control (FOC) when encoder available.
          Open loop with up to 512 microsteps per full step, step loss detection and automatic position compensation when encoder available on the load.
    Operating modes:
          Position, speed and torque control
          Path generator with trapezoidal and sinusoidal ramps
          Profile Position Mode, Velocity Mode, Homing Mode
          Interpolated position with linear (PT) and cubic splines (PVT)
          Cyclic Synchronous Position (CSP), Velocity (CSV), Torque (CST)
          Electronic gears (EGEAR) and cams (ECAM)
          Motion contouring via position, speed, torque or voltage
          Analogue external reference, pulse and direction
    EasyMotion Studio-Software:
        Graphic programming interface with many functions and wizards for simple commissioning, configuration and local programming of complex sequence programs in single-axis or multi-axis systems.
          Enables the selection of motor type, encoder interface and control structure as well as the setting of protection and controller parameters.
          Automatic determination of the PID controller parameters (autotuning).
          Extended analysis and optimization tools integrated using the control panels, loggers and scope functionalities.
    Technosoft Motion Language (TML) programming language: Using the TML language, different operating modes, movement profiles, reference runs or the control of complex sequence programs can be graphically programmed and executed autonomously. The drive controllers can process analog and digital I / O signals, perform arithmetic and logical operations, and also exchange data and commands between the axes. Single-axis and multi-axis stand-alone applications can be easily implemented with self-created sequence programs, even without the use of a complex CANopen or EtherCAT master controller.
    MotionChip ™ technology: The main core of all Technosoft servo controllers is the MotionChip ™ - an intelligent, freely programmable motion controller specially designed for complex motion control tasks. The MotionChip ™ offers the possibility to use the powerful digital signal processors (DSP) from Texas Instruments as an independent, intelligent unit. As a result, many tasks of a complex master control are solved directly by the MotionChip ™, so that the global function of a machine is relieved and the management of a master application can be optimized. All-important control functions of a controller such as a multitude of operating modes, PLC properties, protection and safety functions as well as support for the different interface and motor technologies are accommodated on the MotionChip ™, thus enabling flexible use in a wide variety of drive systems.
